page.title: 06FARMING IN BOURNE END
page.content: There are three farms,Pigeon House Farm (300 acres),Hollands Farm (230 acres) and Well End Farm (114 acres).Pigeon House is an arable farm,growing mainly corn crops,and exchanging crops with the local market garden.Hollands Farm has dairy cattle, the herd being changed from Guernsey to Friesian.Well End Farm has calves,being self- contained like Hollands Farm, growing its own grass for silage and hay and turnips for the cattle. The Lunnon family have owned Hollands Farm for many generations,(a book has been published about them).Well End Farm is the older of the two smaller farms, being built in the sixteenth century. The Lunnon family have been working there since 1750.A yew tree mentioned in the original Domesday Book,is said to be still standing in the farm today.
